sen.j: 鉄炮記（てっぽうき、鐵炮記)は、江戸時代のに成立した鉄砲伝来に関わる歴史書である。
sen.e: Teppoki ("Gun Chronicle") is a history book concerning the transmission of guns to Japan, and was completed in 1606 during the Edo period.

sen.j: 戦国時代(日本)に種子島へ鉄砲（火縄銃）が伝来された史実を領主である種子島久時が、父種子島時堯の鉄砲入手とその製法確立の過程を薩摩国大竜寺の和尚である南浦文之に編纂させたものである。
sen.e: The book is based on the account given by Hisatoki TANEGASHIMA, a local lord, concerning the historical fact of the tranmission of guns (specifically, arquebuses) to Japan on Tanegashima island during the Sengoku (warring states) period, describing how Hisatoki's father Tokitaka TANEGASHIMA had acquired guns and established his gun manufacturing process; this account was edited by the abbot of Satsuma province's Dairyuji temple, Fumi MINAMIURA.

sen.j: 日本へは原始的な火器は倭寇などにより鉄砲伝来以前に持ち込まれていたとする宇田川武久らの説もあるが、『鉄炮記』に記されているのはにポルトガル人により種子島へ鉄砲（火縄銃）が持ち込まれたとする事件（鉄砲伝来）を意味する。
sen.e: Another theory, advanced by Takehisa UDAGAWA and others, holds that before the foreign transmission of guns to Japan primitive firearms were already in use, having been introduced by wako (Japanese pirates) and so forth, but the account in the Teppoki describes the incident of the Portugese sailors' arrival and their bringing of firearms (arquebuses) to Tanegashima island in 1543 (which is termed "the transmission of guns").

Another theory, advanced by Takehisa UDAGAWA and others, holds that before the arrival of guns in Japan, primitive firearms had already been introduced into by wako (Japanese pirates) and other people, but the "Teppoki" provides an account of how firearms (arquebuses) were brought to Tanegashima Island in 1543 by Portuguese sailors ("introduction of guns into Japan").

sen.j: 『鉄炮記』の記述は詳細で、種子島への鉄砲伝来に関しての史料が他にないこともあり伝来説の根本史料として利用される。
sen.e: Both because the description given in the Teppoki is very detailed and because no other historical record describing the transmission of guns on Tanegashima island exists, the Teppoki is used as the source document for the transmission theory.
